name: Composite Price
description: The CP data type is used to communicate prices and pricing information in healthcare transactions. It provides a structured way to represent monetary amounts along with pricing components, currency information, and price qualifiers. This data type supports complex pricing scenarios including itemized billing, insurance calculations, and multi-currency environments common in healthcare financial transactions.

CP.1.name: Price
CP.1.description: The monetary amount representing the price. This component contains both the numeric value and currency designation.

CP.2.name: Price Type
CP.2.description: Specifies the type or category of the price (e.g., unit price, total price, discount price). Indicates the nature of the pricing information.

CP.3.name: From Value
CP.3.description: The lower bound of a price range. Used when specifying price ranges or quantity breaks in pricing structures.

CP.4.name: To Value
CP.4.description: The upper bound of a price range. Used in conjunction with From Value to specify complete price ranges.

CP.5.name: Range Units
CP.5.description: The units of measure for the From Value and To Value components. Specifies what the range values represent (e.g., quantity, volume, time period).

CP.6.name: Range Type
CP.6.description: Specifies the type of range being described (e.g., quantity break, time-based pricing, volume discount). Provides context for the range values.

constraints.priceRequired: CP.1 (Price) is typically required for meaningful pricing information
constraints.rangeLogic: If range values are specified, both From Value and To Value should be provided
constraints.currency: Currency specification handled within the MO (Money) data type in CP.1

generationHints.typical: Use realistic healthcare pricing appropriate for services, procedures, and supplies
generationHints.amounts: Vary from small copays ($10-50) to major procedures ($1000-50000)
generationHints.currency: Primarily USD for US healthcare, but support international currencies
generationHints.ranges: Use quantity breaks and volume discounts for realistic pricing scenarios

priceTypes.UP: Unit Price - price per individual unit
priceTypes.TP: Total Price - complete price for the service or item
priceTypes.DC: Discount Price - reduced price from standard pricing
priceTypes.IP: Insurance Price - price specific to insurance coverage

pricingScenarios.singlePrice: Simple unit or total price without ranges
pricingScenarios.quantityBreaks: Different pricing based on quantity ranges
pricingScenarios.tieredPricing: Multiple price levels based on various criteria

validationRules.priceRequired: CP.1 (Price) should be populated for meaningful pricing data
validationRules.rangeConsistency: If range values are used, From Value should be less than To Value
validationRules.currencyValidation: Currency codes should follow ISO 4217 standards
validationRules.priceTypeValidation: Price Type should reference valid table values
validationRules.rangeUnitsValidation: Range Units should be appropriate for the pricing context

financialContext.billingIntegration: Used in charge description master and billing systems

relatedDataTypes.MO: Money - used in CP.1 for the actual price amount
relatedDataTypes.NM: Numeric - used for range values in CP.3 and CP.4
relatedDataTypes.CE: Coded Element - used for range units in CP.5
relatedDataTypes.ID: Coded Value - used for price and range types

implementationNotes.complexity: Supports sophisticated pricing models beyond simple unit costs
implementationNotes.flexibility: Accommodates various healthcare pricing scenarios and structures
implementationNotes.integration: Designed to work with healthcare billing and financial systems
implementationNotes.standardization: Provides consistent pricing representation across HL7 messages
